channel.title: Project 06 [RS 2006 Remake] - by Prestige Unlimited
channel.description:
[center][b][u][size=12pt]Project 06 - an old RS remake![/size][/u][/b] [b]Note: This server will work on Windows and Mac![/b] [hr] [img]http://screensnapr.com/e/3k9nTr.png[/img] [hr] Project 06 is coded by Prestige Unlimited completely from scratch. There are absolutely no sources involved.
[center][b]Percentage Done with the Game:[/b] [size=18pt]2.73%[/size][/center] -For those who won't stop asking, this percentage is found from our overall to-do list. We count the items on this list, and calculate the percentage from things that are complete and incomplete.
[center][s]__________________________________________________________________________[/s][/center] [center][s]__________________________________________________________________________[/s][/center]
[b]Summary[/b] Project 06 is a project that will attempt to completely remake the old version of RuneScape. It's not the average RSPS with easier skilling. We will be having all quests, skills, mini-games, and features as well as a hint of our own creativity. Prestige Unlimited is a small but talented developing group with lots of experience. Our inspiration is the thought of the final result, knowing that we will look back on it with extreme satisfaction. We will be satisfied by making people happy from playing the game and knowing that we accomplished something great. Our ultimate goal to get from all of this is to remake RS as it was in 2006-2007. At the end of the day it isn't your normal RSPS. It's a RuneScape time machine back to what it used to be, the game we all loved.
[b]Quick FAQ[/b] Q: What do you use to code the server? A: Netbeans, found at http://www.netbeans.org.
Q: Who's apart of this project? A: Kane and Ethan own the project. There are other staff members as well.
[hr]
[b]Apply to be a Developer[/b] [code]Name/username: How old are you?: Other ways of contact?: Timezone?: What language do you code?: How long have you been coding?: How active are you on the computer?: Past experience with coding (other projects,etc)?:[/code]
Sorry, we are no longer accepting any more beta testers.
[hr]
Beta Testers: Now that we have enough beta testers, we will no longer be accepting any more. [b]8/8[/b]
1. [b]Unknowed[/b] 2. [b]Base Drop[/b] 3. [b]Xisc[/b] 4. [b]Pistachio[/b] 5. [b]Sontch[/b] 6. [b]Rory[/b] 7. [b]Diesel[/b] 8. [b]Cliche[/b]
[center][s]__________________________________________________________________________[/s][/center]
[b]Server Visuals[/b]
[u]Videos[/u] Coming soon. The Project 06 YouTube channel can be found [url=http://www.youtube.com/project06]here[/url].
[u]Pictures[/u] [img]http://i.imgur.com/9Psgu.png[/img] [img]http://screensnapr.com/e/MTmAbt.png[/img] [hr] [b]Credits[/b] [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=499456]Kane[/url] [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=567276]Ethan[/url]

item.title: Project 06 [RS 2006 Remake] - by Prestige Unlimited
item.dc:creator: @_Kane † Kane †
item.description:
@_Kane wrote:

@Coelho

Ethan isn’t the coder of this, so he might not be 100% on some of the details.

It’s not that things were unorganized, I just didn’t like the way I was coding it so I re-wrote a few things and organized it differently.

Also, how can you say the organization of this is bad? I don’t see how you’re coming up with that conclusion?

Coelho:

I don’t see this going anywhere, but I do compliment you for putting out an effort.

We’re actually moving along quite well. I’m spending a lot of time coding the skills and making sure every feature in a skill works as it should. It also helps that we have people willing to help us with things such as getting specific ID’s for emotes and such (working on Agility atm, and getting all the emotes is a hassle).

If you want any other questions answered, message me for an explanation.

Read full topic

item.title: Project 06 [RS 2006 Remake] - by Prestige Unlimited
item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

[quote=“xEthanx, post:17, topic:443415”][quote author=Native^ link=topic=546103.msg4005884#msg4005884 date=1338638106]

  • what’s the cycle time?
    [/quote]
    2ms[/quote]
    What? The cycle time in RuneScape is 600ms.
    If you were talking about the execution time per cycle, then 2ms is absolutely horrible for a practically idle server. Not to mention, you never specified if you were even logged into the server when calculating the cycle time, or how many entities were currently being processed.

[quote=“xEthanx, post:29, topic:443415”][quote author=† Kane † link=topic=546103.msg4008062#msg4008062 date=1338864518]

What is the networking library you used for this server?

Now we’ve switched to using Netty.
[/quote]
We’re rewriting our entire source code actually.

Things were organized awfully and some things just plain inconvenient, so we have rewritten the engine in a more compatible way if that makes sense.[/quote]
How do you expect the software to be even substantially good if you do not plan out the structure beforehand? It seems like you are just winging it as you go, which will lead to a horribly unoptimized server.

OT: For a “scratch” server software, the organization of the project seems really bad. The person who wrote the thread seems to sound like he hasn’t the slightest clue about of what he is talking about, as if it was foreign.

I don’t see this going anywhere, but I do compliment you for putting out an effort.

Read full topic

item.title: Project 06 [RS 2006 Remake] - by Prestige Unlimited
item.dc:creator: @_Kane † Kane †
item.description:
@_Kane wrote:

For anyone who cares, we will be having a name change in the near future before release. We were planning this anyway, and we are just using the one we have now as a temporary name.

In development news, after hours of work, I’ve documented and implemented 56 packets for the 317 client into the server and they’re all working perfectly. I may have missed a few, but I’m pretty sure all the important ones are implemented at the moment.

Read full topic
